title: Green Bean, Potato, and Red Onion Salad
introduction: Green Bean, Potato, and Red Onion Salad is a delightful and refreshing alternative to traditional leafy green salads, popular across southern Italy. This easy-to-prepare dish combines tender potatoes, crisp green beans, and the zesty flavor of red onions. The salad is enhanced with a tangy dressing of extra-virgin olive oil, red wine vinegar, and your choice of fresh herbs like basil, mint, or parsley.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh basil, mint, or parsley, or 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
instructions: Place the potatoes in a medium saucepan and add cold water to cover and salt to taste. Cover and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook until the potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife, about 20 minutes. Drain well. Let cool slightly. Peel the potatoes and cut into 1/4-inch slices.

Bring another large saucepan of water to a boil. Add the green beans and salt to taste. Cook the beans until they are tender, about 8 minutes. Drain the beans and cool them under running water. Drain and pat dry. Cut the beans into bite-size pieces.
In a large bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar, herbs, and salt and pepper to taste. Add the potatoes, beans, and onion and toss well. Taste and adjust seasoning. Serve immediately.
